reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for just one night -- a pity, should have stayed longer. Really nice welcome and a fine breakfast. The advice on where to rent a car was welcome as Agate Beach is a long way off, and Old Masset would be a long walk.
reviews.title: Private attic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When travelling, you end up staying at many different types and quality of accommodations. Occasionally, ones stand out that create memories. The Copper Beech House is one of these.
reviews.title: My favourite B&B ever!

reviews.text: We were greeted by an adorable young lady by the name of Julia. She made sure we were settled in OK and that everything was good. We were staying in the "Garden View Suite" (all the room have names and their own character). An amazingly comfortable and king sized bed awaited our sleeping pleasure, with windows and curtains all around. The room is effectively a self contained apartment minus the cooking facilities.
reviews.title: This B&B is a wonderful and different experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As it turned out, Susan Musgrave, the owner, renowned poet and, as it turned out, an incredibly talented cook, was preparing a meal for the guests that night. For a minimal price, we enjoyed a gourmet quality meal with a very interesting group of people (funky places seem to attract interesting people!). While not licensed, we enjoyed a bottle of our own wine with the meal and the stimulating conversation.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just love Susan to bits. You'd never know she was a major force in literature by her personality: warm, VERY funny and real...she's one of those people you just instinctively like! She also helped us out by arranging a great local guide (Hi, Arbor!!) to allow us to watch day break out at the end of the Rose Spit, the site of the Haida birth of creation legend.
reviews.title: Made us feel at home in Masset
